    MARP: Many Analysts Religion Project dataset

    marp.Rd

    Dataset from the Many Analysts Religion Project. Analysts explored relations between religiosity and well-being across multiple countries.

    data(marp)

    Format

    A data frame with 10,535 rows (participants) and 46 variables:

    subject

    Integer subject identifier (row id in processed file).

    country

    Country of participant (character).

    rel_1 ... rel_9

    Religiosity items. Many are proportion-style or binary indicators derived from self-report (values in 0,1 or integer/binary).

    cnorm_1, cnorm_2

    Perceived cultural norm variables: importance of a religious lifestyle and importance of belief for the average person in the participant's country (numeric scales).

    wb_gen_1, wb_gen_2

    General well-being items (single-item self-assessments; integer Likert).

    wb_phys_1 ... wb_phys_7

    Well-being — physical domain items; integer Likert responses (e.g., 1–5).

    wb_psych_1 ... wb_psych_6

    Well-being — psychological domain items; integer Likert responses.

    wb_soc_1 ... wb_soc_3

    Well-being — social domain items; integer Likert responses.

    wb_overall_mean

    Participant-level mean across all well-being items (numeric).

    wb_phys_mean

    Mean of the physical well-being items (numeric).

    wb_psych_mean

    Mean of the psychological well-being items (numeric).

    wb_soc_mean

    Mean of the social well-being items (numeric).

    age

    Age of participant in years (integer).

    gender

    Self-reported gender (character). In the notebook gender was recoded to "Male", "Female", "Other".

    ses

    Socio-economic status (numeric/integer scale used in the dataset).

    education

    Education level coded as integers (ordinal).

    ethnicity

    Self-reported ethnicity (character).

    denomination

    Religious denomination (character).

    gdp

    Country-level GDP per capita (numeric).

    gdp_scaled

    Scaled GDP used for models (numeric).

    sample_type

    Sample recruitment type (character; e.g., "online panel", "student sample").

    compensation

    Compensation type (character; e.g., "monetary reward").

    attention_check

    Attention-check variable (integer).

    Source

    Many Analysts Religion Project — Team 40 exploratory notebook (processed MARP data). See Team 40 MARP notebook for preprocessing and analysis details. :contentReference[oaicite:2]index=2

    Examples

    if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
library(dplyr)
data(marp)
## quick checks
dim(marp)
glimpse(marp)
## country-level mean religiosity
marp  |>
  select(country, starts_with("rel_")) |>
  group_by(country) |>
  summarise(across(starts_with("rel_"), ~ mean(.x, na.rm = TRUE)))
} # }
